content.description:
Stick clip! Definitely stick clip. If you do it's no longer PG 13 and you will have a much less stressful time climbing this. 

Start up steep, hard slab to the first bolt (possibly the crux). Continue up on hard slab until you reach the respite of the corner. Continue up, pulling the slight overhang to a good rest. Clip up and bash out the last few meters of easy climbing to the anchor. The slab and the corner are very insecure; full value!



Look for the bolt line that starts just left of the prominent corner. The bolt line angles into the corner and onto the steeper rock. 

8 bolts, fat Metolius rap hangers, stick clip!!!

Off the deck, pull into the corner using an awesome jug and clip your first bolt overhead. Will the rest of the route have holds this good?! No. Crux time. Pull out of the corner to the right through the weakness (where the grass is) on big holds and have a quick rest. Finish out through a very airy section on decent holds!



Starts in the prominent corner. 

5 bolts

A true Jasper mega classic and test piece. This magnificent slab line follows a lay back flake into tricky stemming on barely visible runnels and edges. Be flexible, be creative, and more than anything else, climb beautifully. The slab eases and hits a sit down rest at mid-height where you can pop off your shoes and wiggle your toes until they stop burning. Cruise the rest of the route to a pair of fat Metolius rap hangers!

Just kidding, put your shoes back on and get your head in the game, the second half of the climb hosts the slab mini-boulder crux, followed by more, incredibly sustained and very tenuous slab climbing all the way to the anchor. 

The rock is magnificent, and the movement is incredible. Do not miss this climb!



The bolt line that goes directly up the slab, starting on a flake (the edge faces right). Just a few meters left of the prominent left facing corner.

9 bolts

Home to 2 of the hardest climbs in Hidden Valley, and the namesake Spiderman Slab, a Jasper area test piece. If you're climbing in Hidden Valley, do not miss this wall! Morning shade, afternoon sun. Slab and corners!
